intro: Nematanthus gregarius, commonly known as the silverleaf gloxinia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, often reaching heights of up to 3 feet. Its flowers, which come in shades of red, orange, and yellow, bloom in the spring and summer months. Nematanthus gregarius thrives in bright, indirect light and prefers well-draining soil.
